---
title: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome (TOS)
---

Types:

- Arterial
- Venous
- Nerve


# Causes

- Tumor
- 1st rib elevation
- Pec minor tight (especially at full elevation)
- Ant/mid scalene
- Cervical rib approximation


## Testing

- Tumor
- 1st rib elevation
- Pec minor tight (especially at full elevation)
- Cervical rib approximation
    - [Costoclavicular Test]({{< var ref-tos-costoclavicular-test.path >}})

- Ant/mid scalene
    - [Adsonâ€™s Vascular Test]({{< var ref-tos-adsons-vascular-test.path >}}) (Not recommended)
- [Costoclavicular Test]({{< var ref-tos-costoclavicular-test.path >}})
- [Roos Test]({{< var ref-tos-roos-stress-test.path >}})
- [Wright Test (Hyperabduction Maneuver)]({{< var ref-tos-wright-test.path >}})
- [Passive Shoulder Shrug]({{< var ref-tos-passive-shoulder-shrug-test.path >}})

:::{.callout-caution}
- Little reliability with these tests (despite widespread use) @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
- With all of these tests: (+) test = diminution or disappearance of pulse or neuro symptoms @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
:::
